meanings.definition: To undo the seam or seams of (something)
meanings.sent1: She carefully unseams the torn dress to mend it.
meanings.sent2: The tailor unseams the old jacket to repurpose the fabric.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten unseams the cushion, leaving a mess of fluff everywhere.
meanings.sent4: His words unseam the fragile bond of trust between them.
meanings.sent5: The seamstress unseams the intricate embroidery with precision and skill.

meanings.definition: To separate the parts of (something) by cutting or tearing along a seam
meanings.sent1: He unseams the paper with scissors to create a clean edge.
meanings.sent2: The chef unseams the chicken breast to stuff it with herbs.
meanings.sent3: The naughty puppy unseams the wrapping paper, revealing the gift inside.
meanings.sent4: The storm unseams the roof, exposing the interior to the elements.
meanings.sent5: She unseams the fabric to make alterations to the garment.
